entries.meaning: (uncountable) The state or quality of being stern.
examples: There was the sternness of an old-fashioned Tour patron in his rebuke to the young Frenchman Pierre Rolland, the only one to ride away from the peloton and seize the opportunity for a lone attack before being absorbed back into the bunch, where he was received with coolness.

entries.meaning: (countable) The result or product of being stern.
